column1: PITTSBURGH ( AP ) -- The All - Star Game was all set up for the National League this time . 	 Trevor Hoffman on the mound
column3: fans on their feet at Pittsburgh 's enchanting ballpark . 	 But no matter the setting or the season
column4: the National League ca n't find a way to close out the American League . 	 Down to a final strike
column5: Michael Young hit a two - run triple off Hoffman for a 3 - 2 victory Tuesday night that kept the AL unbeaten for the past decade . 	 " You 're never going to forget these things on this kind of stage
column7: who has 460 saves . " You feel like you let a lot of people down . " 	 Young took home the MVP Award -- and the AL won home - field advantage in the World Series for the fourth consecutive year . 	 " Nobody wants to make the last out of anything
column9: World Series or an All - Star Game
column11: whose double set the stage for Young . 	 Behind David Wright 's homer and daring baserunning
column12: the NL took a 2 - 1 lead into the ninth . 	  INLINE TABLE ( BEGIN ) 	  INLINE TABLE ( END ) 	 Houston manager Phil Garner went to Hoffman
column13: who is closing in on Lee Smith 's career saves record ( 478 ) and has converted 24 of 25 chances this season . 	 After getting two soft comebackers
column14: Hoffman gave up a single to Paul Konerko
column15: who was replaced by pinch - runner Jose Lopez . 	 Then the NL nearly caught a break -- it has n't had many since its last All - Star Game victory in Philadelphia in 1996 . 	 Glaus ' smash bounded over the left - field fence for a ground - rule double
column16: perhaps preventing Lopez from scoring . He was held at third
column17: until Young made that moot . 	 The Rangers shortstop lined an 0 - 2 pitch into right - center and slid into third with what was probably the biggest All - Star Game hit since Texas teammate Hank Blalock 's go - ahead homer off a normally dominant Eric Gagne in the eighth inning in 2003 . 	 " I 'm not going to lie . This is a pretty big highlight in my career
column18: " Young said . " No one 's really giving huge rallying calls to getting home - field advantage in the World Series
column19: but we 're all aware of how important this game is . " 	 Mariano Rivera worked around Lopez 's error at third base for the save
column20: retiring Milwaukee slugger Carlos Lee on a popup with a runner on second to make the AL 9 - 0 - 1 in the All - Star Game over the past 10 years . 	  INLINE TABLE ( BEGIN ) 	  INLINE TABLE ( END ) 	 The NL 's best result was a tie in 2002 in Milwaukee . 	 Call it a decade of dominance for the American League
column21: which got an early homer from Vladimir Guerrero . 	 In fact
column22: the AL has owned the NL year - round lately
column23: sweeping the past two World Series and winning 61 percent of interleague games this season . 	 " I would n't necessarily say domination . We got the breaks tonight
column24: " Derek Jeter said . " It 's one of those things right now . We 're on a roll . The NL was on a roll a few years back . " 	 Once the AL was ahead
column25: manager Ozzie Guillen brought in ol' reliable for the New York Yankees . Rivera 's third All - Star save tied him with Hall of Famer Dennis Eckersley for the career mark since the stat became official in 1969 . 	 " I was honored . We have a lot of great guys and he chose me
column27: " Rivera said . 	 Toronto left - hander B.J. Ryan got the win with a hitless eighth . 	  INLINE TABLE ( BEGIN ) 	  INLINE TABLE ( END ) 	 An exhibition played with a crisp
column29: the game was halted before the fifth inning for a ceremony at home plate for a tribute to the late Pirates great Roberto Clemente . 	 Bud Selig presented the commissioner 's historic achievement award to Clemente 's widow
column31: who was escorted to the podium by Pirates Hall of Famer Bill Mazeroski . 	 Guillen
column32: wearing a Clemente T - shirt under his gray Chicago White Sox road jersey
column33: appeared to wipe tears from his eyes
column34: and highlights of Clemente 's stellar career were shown on the video board high above left field . 	 The Hall of Fame right fielder was killed in a plane crash while delivering relief supplies to earthquake victims in Nicaragua on Dec. 31
column35: 1972 . 	 " Roberto was a hero in every sense of the term
column36: " Selig said . 	 With several National Leaguers admittedly tired of losing
column37: they certainly came out to play . 	 Garner smartly worked his pitcher - batter matchups -- as he said he would -- and the NL employed a drastic overshift against Boston slugger David Ortiz . 	 The AL 's 41 - year - old starting pitcher
column39: made a hard dive for Chase Utley 's infield single in the second . 	 NL starter Brad Penny of the Los Angeles Dodgers said Monday his nerves would be " flowing
column40: " and maybe that helped him at the outset . 	 Popping the mitt of Mets catcher Paul Lo Duca -- the two were traded for each other nearly two years ago -- Penny struck out Ichiro Suzuki
column41: Jeter and Ortiz in succession with a series of 98 mph fastballs . 	 The only other pitcher to start an All - Star Game with three consecutive strikeouts was Boston 's Pedro Martinez at Fenway Park in 1999
column42: when he set down former MVPs Barry Larkin
column43: Larry Walker and Sammy Sosa . 	 Guerrero hit his first All - Star homer in the second off Penny
column44: over the short porch in right field . Wright
column45: who hit 16 homers in the first round of the Home Run Derby before losing to Philadelphia 's Ryan Howard in the finals Monday night
column46: connected in the bottom half against Rogers . 	 " I got a lot of practice last night
column47: " Wright said . 	 Alfonso Soriano and Carlos Beltran each stole a base in the third against strong - armed catcher Ivan Rodriguez
column48: an 11 - time Gold Glove winner and 13 - time All - Star . 	 Soriano was on second when Beltran singled
column49: but Toronto 's Gold Glove center fielder
column51: cut down the speedy Soriano with a perfect throw to the plate . 	 Beltran reached second on the throw and stole third with two outs -- with Albert Pujols at the plate . The Mets ' center fielder then scored on a wild pitch by Roy Halladay that glanced off Rodriguez
column52: giving the NL its first lead since that eighth inning in 2003 . 	 " I was prepared to close the game out . I prepared like it was a regular - season game
column53: and came out and threw strikes
column55: " Hoffman said . 	 Game notes 	 Some players and umpires wore yellow wristbands with the initials RCW for Roberto Clemente Walker . Even pitchers were allowed to wear them
column56: on their glove hands . Young 's special wristband is headed to the Hall of Fame . ... The NL lost for the 	 first time in five All - Star games in Pittsburgh . ... Wright became the 13th player to homer in his first All - Star game at - bat . ... Beltran played all nine innings
column57: the first All - Star to do it since Ken Griffey Jr. and Ray Lankford in 1997 . ... At 2:33
column58: this was the fastest All - Star Game since it took 2:26 in 1988 . ... A third baseman for most of his career
column59: Glaus shifted to first base for the ninth inning . He 's never played the position in a regular - season game . " That made me nervous
column60: " he said . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
column61: $ 8 million contract . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more
column62: this is your one - stop shop as baseball 's 2021 hardware is handed out . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season
column63: leading all rookies with a 4.1 WAR . 	 Take a look back at the best plays from NL Rookie of the Year Jonathan India 's 2021 campaign . 	 Julio Lugo

column1: BALTIMORE ( AP ) -- Mark Teixeira has been insisting for months 	 that his swing is no different from a year ago
column2: when he hit 43 	 homers and drove in 144 runs . 	  INLINE TABLE BEGIN 	 INLINE TABLE END 	 He backed up that assertion Thursday night against the Baltimore 	 Orioles . 	 Teixeira hit a career - high three homers and drove in seven runs
column3: and the Rangers hit six home runs in a 15 - 1 rout . 	 Teixeira had only nine homers and 49 RBI before the All - Star 	 break
column4: leading to speculation that he had lost his power stroke . He 	 scoffed at the suggestion earlier this season
column5: and hammered home 	 the point after battering the Orioles . 	 " Same thing I 've said all year : my swing has not changed one 	 bit . I 've looked at hours and hours of video
column6: " Teixeira said . 	 " There 's a fine line between a home run and a line drive . Tonight 	 I just kind of found that home run stroke . " 	 Teixeira hit a sacrifice fly in the first inning
column7: a solo homer 	 in the sixth
column8: a two - run shot in the eighth and a three - run drive in 	 the ninth . The seven RBI tied a career high . 	 He has 12 homers
column9: including four in his last two games . It was 	 his 12th career multihomer game
column10: the first this season . 	 " I do n't know if I 'd call it a breakout performance
column11: but it 's 	 nice to have a good game here in Baltimore
column13: who 	 was born and raised in Maryland . " It 's a big win for us . Coming 	 off a break
column14: we 're tied for first place and we scored a lot of 	 runs . " 	 Texas totaled 19 hits and reached a season - high in home runs . 	 Brad Wilkerson hit his 14th homer and drove in four runs
column15: and 	 Rod Barajas also homered for the Rangers
column16: who got at least one hit 	 from every starter . Mark DeRosa went 4 - for-4 with a home run and 	 two walks . 	 But this game was all about Teixeira
column17: who had only four homers 	 on the road before Thursday . 	 " You feel really good for him . You know how much he wants it 	 and he 's been such a big contributor for us this year
column19: " Texas manager Buck Showalter said . " But it 's 	 such a level that he 's spoiled us last year
column20: it 's hard to stay 	 there . Tonight was a big reminder of what he 's capable of . " 	 Vicente Padilla ( 9 - 5 ) gave up one run and four hits in seven 	 innings to win his third straight start . The right - hander struck 	 out three and walked three . 	 The game was tied at one before Texas got seven hits in a six - run 	 sixth . 	 Teixeira hit a leadoff homer and Ian Kinsler drew a one - out walk 	 before Kevin Mench hit a ground - rule double . Wilkerson then chased 	 Daniel Cabrera ( 4 - 7 ) with a two - run double for a 4 - 1 lead . 	 Wilkerson was tagged out at the plate trying to score on 	 Barajas ' single off Chris Britton
column21: but Gary Matthews Jr. followed 	 with a single and DeRosa hit a three - run shot to left . 	 Wilkerson 's two - run homer in the seventh off Sendy Rleal made it 	 9 - 1 . 	 " Once we get going
column23: " Wilkerson said . 	 Cabrera allowed four runs
column24: six hits and five walks in 5 1/3 	 innings . The right - hander is 0 - 5 in his last six starts and leads 	 the AL with 75 walks in 85 2/3 innings . 	 " I try to make a pitch
column26: " Cabrera 	 said . " I know I 've got to do something . It 's been six starts . I 	 do n't know the last time I pitched good . " 	 Texas went up 1 - 0 in the first when Cabrera hit Matthews with a 	 pitch
column27: walked DeRosa and yielded a sacrifice fly to Teixeira . 	 Baltimore tied it in the third when Nick Markakis doubled and 	 scored on a single by Brandon Fahey . 	 Cabrera received some fine defensive support in the fifth . After 	 Fahey made a nice running grab of a foul liner hit by Matthews
column28: DeRosa singled before Brian Roberts snapped up a sharp grounder by 	 Michael Young and started a 4 - 6 - 3 double play . 	 " We had ourselves a ball game for a little while
column30: " and then the wheels fell off . " 	 Game notes 	 Baltimore 's Ramon Hernandez hit his 20th double
column31: one more 	 than he had all last season with San Diego . He 's tied with Miguel Tejada for the team lead . ... Young
column32: the All - Star game MVP with a 	 two - run triple in the ninth
column33: went 1 - for-5 and hit into two double 	 plays . ... It was the 35th time this season the Orioles have 	 allowed at least four runs in an inning
column34: the most in the majors . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
column35: $ 8 million contract . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: BOSTON ( AP ) -- Mark Loretta 's All - Star buzz did n't last very 	 long . 	 The Red Sox second baseman missed Bobby Kielty 's easy grounder 	 and allowed an unearned
column2: game - tying run to score on Thursday night 	 as the Oakland Athletics rallied to send the game into extra 	 innings and beat Boston 5 - 4 in the 11th . 	 " I took my eye off it and it was gone
column4: who made 	 his first All - Star start on Tuesday night thanks to a first half in 	 which he committed just three of the team 's major league - leading 30 	 errors . " It was more a mental lapse than anything . " 	 Kielty singled to score Jason Kendall and break an 11th - inning 	 tie
column5: then stole second and scored on Frank Thomas ' single to make 	 it 5 - 3 . Jason Varitek 's RBI single in the bottom of the inning made 	 it Oakland 's league - leading 18th one - run victory of the season . 	 " Every day is a one - run game
column6: " A 's manager Ken Macha said . 	 " It seems that way
column7: at least . " 	 Huston Street ( 3 - 3 ) pitched 1 2/3 innings
column10: who is supposed to start on Monday
column11: got the 	 last two outs for his second save ; he was the eighth Oakland 	 pitcher in the game . 	 " After you get three days off
column12: you like to get guys back into 	 the game to get their feet wet
column13: " Macha said . " We basically did 	 that in one game . " 	 It was Boston 's first home loss in 10 games since June 11 . The 	 Red Sox left at least one runner on base in 10 of the 11 innings . 	 The Red Sox
column14: who played 19 innings in their last game before the 	 All - Star break
column16: but two runs scored -- one unearned 	 -- on Loretta 's seventh - inning error . It stayed 3 - 3 until the 11th
column17: when Kendall doubled with one out and Nick Swisher
column19: struck out on a close - call checked swing . 	 Kielty hit a hard liner off the scoreboard of the Green Monster
column20: and Kendall scored easily . Thomas added the insurance run against 	 Julian Tavarez ( 1 - 3 )
column22: allowing three hits 	 and two runs . 	 Oakland had lost four of five and seven of its previous 10 	 games . 	 Boston rookie Jon Lester pitched five laborious innings
column23: needing 	 103 pitches to qualify for what would have been his fifth 	 consecutive victory . He allowed one run
column24: five hits and five walks 	 while striking out three before leaving with a 3 - 1 lead . 	 Craig Hansen pitched a perfect sixth but gave up singles to 	 Antonio Perez and Kendall to lead off the seventh . Manny Delcarmen 	 came on with one out and runners on second and third and got Kielty 	 to hit an easy grounder to second
column25: where Loretta took his eye off 	 the ball and it went by him for an error . 	 Perez and Kendall scored -- the latter run was unearned -- to make 	 it 3 - 3 . 	 David Ortiz was 2 - for-4 with two walks . He doubled to lead off 	 the third and scored on Trot Nixon 's single to give Boston a 2 - 1 	 lead . Varitek singled and Mike Lowell
column26: who hit a solo homer in the 	 second
column27: added an RBI fielder 's choice to make it 3 - 1 . 	 Game notes 	 After the game
column28: the A 's activated OF Milton Bradley from 	 the 15 - day DL and optioned 1B Dan Johnson to Triple - A Sacramento . 	 ... With the no - decision
column29: Lester can still become the first Red Sox 	 rookie to win his first five decisions since Aaron Sele won six to 	 start his career in 1993 . ... A 's 3B Eric Chavez
column30: bothered by 	 tendinitis in both forearms
column31: was not in the starting lineup . He has 	 played in just six of the previous 10 games . ... The Red Sox 	 purchased LHP Craig Breslow 's contract from Triple - A Pawtucket .
